availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson Combs (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer, distiller, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer, distiller, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Ann Rogers Combs in Perry County, Kentucky, on April 11, 1836. Father of Horace Combs, Martha Ann Combs, John Combs, Anna Elizabeth Combs, Lydia A. Combs, William O. B. Combs, Laura N.B. Combs, Mary J. Combs, and Charles B. Combs. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1863. Distiller in Montgomery County in 1863. Justice of the peace in Montgomery County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 279.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 80.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Missouri, Clay County, Fishing River, District 125, p. 410D.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Montgomery County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 265.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Montgomery County, KY, October 1863.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Perry County Marriages, Film 000968277, p. 41.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Births, p. 5.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Montgomery County Wills, vol. D-F, 1828-1874, p. 146.
L.C. Jeffries, Diary of Doctor Luther Calvin Jeffries, Part 2, 1860-1870, Montgomery County History Museum, Mt. Sterling, KY, p. 11.
